item.description: Saanich will acquire 32 acres of land in the Blenkinsop Valley at $1,250,00 for park and trail connections.

item.description: Offered once per year. Act quickly! Last year's sold out in one day. One per individual.

item.description: Saanich residents will find some new landmarks at neighbourhood recreation facilities and the Municipal Hall.

item.description:
With one in four children above a healthy weight, this new program run by Saanich Parks & Recreation aims to improve
the health of our local kids.

item.title: Craigflower Bridge closes - 5 am on Wednesday, April 10, 2013
item.description: Closed to all motor vehicle traffic.  Cyclists and pedrestrians can use the bridge until further notice.

item.description: The District of Saanich and Habitat for Humanity Victoria have signed an agreement that will see Habitat pursue its next build project in the Municipality’s North Quadra community.

item.description: Mr. Chazottes will receive the Queen Elizabeth II Diamond Jubilee Medal for his outstanding public service to the region.

item.title: Phasing Out of the Penny
item.description: As of Tuesday, Feb. 12th all cash transactions will be rounded to nearest nickel. Other transacations unaffected.

item.title: Kitchen Scraps Recycling Pilot Project
item.description: A total of 19.42 tonnes of kitchen scraps were diverted from the landfill and recycled as part of the three month pilot project. With 95% of households participating, response to the pilot project was terrific.

item.title: Golf Course Public Consultation
item.description:
The survey that followed the June 20th open house is now closed and Elevate Consulting is now reviewing all the input collected through the Open House, surveys and stakeholder interviews. We will keep you updated on their progress as we move towards a recommendation, likely in the middle of August 2012.

If you would like more information or have questions please contact Saanich Parks and Recreation (recreation@saanich.ca, 250 475-5422).

item.title: 2011 Annual Report
item.description: Endorsed by Mayor and Council on June 25th, 2012.

item.title: Parks, Recreation & Culture Master Plan
item.description: The District of Saanich has developed a Master Plan to guide the direction of the Parks & Recreation Department over the next 5 – 7 years. The Plan will be considered by Council at their July 9/12 Committee of the Whole meeting.

item.title: Saanich Council Appoints New Director of Finance
item.description: Mayor Frank Leonard and Saanich Council are pleased to announce our new Director of Finance.

item.title: Saanich Environmental Awards
item.description: View photos and information about this year's winners from the 2012 Saanich Environmental Awards Presentation June 18th.

item.title: Shelbourne Valley Action Plan Transportation Study Overview
item.description: A powerpoint presentation of the Shelbourne Valley Action Plan Transportation Study is available for viewing. The Study includes a review of concepts and recommended Corridor improvements for walking, cycling, transit and private motor vehicle use through the Shelbourne Corridor. The full study is available for viewing under the Transportation section of the plan page.

item.title: Golf Course Public Consultation
item.description: The District of Saanich is undertaking a public consultation process regarding the use of the 2nd floor clubhouse facilities at Cedar Hill Golf Course.

item.title: Property Tax Notices Have Been Mailed
item.description: The 2012 property tax notices were mailed on May 22, 2012. Taxpayers who have not received their tax notice should contact the Saanich Tax Office by July 3, 2012 to avoid penalty. All unpaid taxes (including unclaimed home owner grants) are subject to a 10% penalty after July 3rd.

item.title: Appointment to Saanich Police Board
item.description: Saanich residents interested in an appointment to the Saanich Police Board are invited to submit a letter of application and accompanying résumé by 4:00 pm, Friday, June 15, 2012.

item.title: Saanich Police Chief Receives Honour
item.description: Saanich Police Chief Constable Michael Chadwick is appointed as an Officer of the Order of Merit of the Police Forces.

item.title: Future GIS Map Service
item.description: We are improving our GIS Map Service to better meet your needs. Please complete this short online survey before June 8th and help shape your municipal GIS.

item.title: Saanich Council Appoints New Chief Administrative Officer
item.description: Paul Murray has been appointed Chief Administrative Officer effective June 1, 2012. The current Chief Administrative Officer, Tim Wood, is retiring on May 31, 2012.

item.title: Kitchen Scraps Recycling Pilot Project Launched in Saanich UPDATE
item.description: 583 households are participating in a pilot project to help us evaluate kitchen scraps recycling and collection models in our municipality in anticipation of the CRD ban on kitchen scraps at the Hartland landfill by 2015. Read the CRD media advisory.

item.title: David Foster Foundation Be A Donor, Save A Life Campaign
item.description: The District of Saanich is pleased to support the David Foster Foundation Be A Donor, Save A Life campaign.

item.title: 2012 Business Survey
item.description: A survey was sent to 1500 randomly selected Saanich businesses, asking for their ideas and opinions about Saanich as a place to do business, and their municipal government. Find the early bird winning ticket numbers.

item.title: Get Ready for Golf
item.description: Cedar Hill Golf Course annual passes are now on sale. Purchase you pass in person at the clubhouse or purchase your pass online.

item.title: Saanich Recreation Surveys
item.description: Your opinion matters. Saanich Recreation online customer surveys now available.

item.title: 2012 to 2016 Draft Financial Plan
item.description: A draft of the financial plan is in circulation until end of April 2012.
